Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal. To show us that you've read the entire job ad, please include the phrase 'YES, I AM SUNDAY'S NEW TEAM MEMBER' in the first sentence of your cover letter.

Contact

Sabrina Thome

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 190 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI
Description:
Our Berlin and Munich offices are expanding! Do you want to be our future data colleague?

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 400 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specializations involving data solutions in a lot of technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going.

As the German market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our German team with new Data colleagues. You will be working in our Berlin or Munich offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful: coffee chats, office dogs, and apéro with colleagues at the end of the day.

Where Your Expertise Is Needed


Rollout Power BI Service as data visualization solution
Setting up, configure and maintain Power BI Service (e.g. Workspaces, Access Control, Data Sources Connectivity)
Building semantic models for reports and dashboards
Building data visualizations
Guiding clients on their digital transformation journey towards cloud native data visualization



What We Are Looking For


Expert in end-to-end Power BI Service ownership (setup, rollout, maintain, utilize)
Expert expertise in SQL, DAX and M
Expert in data modelling (semantic modelling) in Power BI
Native in German and good English knowledge



What We Offer


Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Nordic work culture of trust, responsibility, and maximum freedom
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
A Scandinavian company culture mixed with German culture: read more



We believe the diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation, or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience, and performance.

Interested in hearing more?

We want to hear from you and figure out together what works best for us both. Tell us about yourself and your background in your own words.  Unfortunately, currently we cannot offer relocation for candidates outside Europe.

Our recruitment consists of 3 rounds of interviews where you will meet our team and learn more about working at Solita.

If you would like to hear more about working at Solita, please contact our recruiter Pauline Roy-Malikian: pauline.roy-malikian@solita.be

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Data Analyst (m/w/d) Festanstellung, Vollzeit


München, Berlin oder deutschlandweit remote Deine Aufgaben Wir verändern eine ganze Branche – verändere sie gemeinsam mit uns! You made my day – mit unserer innovativen und marktumwälzenden Plattform geben wir bereits einer Vielzahl von Menschen weltweit Zugang zu einer neuen, flexiblen und selbstbestimmten Arbeitswelt und bieten unseren Kunden durch unsere Software gleichzeitig einen komplett virtuellen und marktrevolutionierenden Kundenservice. Sichere unser weiteres Wachstum und mach mit uns den Unterschied als Data Analyst (m/w/d) in unserem Headquarter in München , im Hauptstadtoffice in Berlin oder auch deutschlandweit remote . Strategische Datenanalyse: Als Senior Data Analyst identifizierst du Datenprodukte für die Unterstützung unseres Wachstums und für die Optimierung unseres Geschäftsmodells. Du setzt diese Datenprodukte gemeinsam mit dem Data-Team um und hilfst so deinen Stakeholdern bei ihrer operativen und strategischen Arbeit Business Partnership: Du fungierst als enger Partner für verschiedene Teams innerhalb des Unternehmens, indem du deren Bedürfnisse verstehst und datenbasierte Lösungen anbietest, die ihre Ziele unterstützen. Durch deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und deine Fähigkeit, komplexe Analysen verständlich zu vermitteln, trägst du aktiv zur Erreichung unserer Unternehmensziele bei Visualisierung und Berichterstattung: Du entwirfst und entwickelst ansprechende Dashboards und Berichte, die komplexe Daten visuell ansprechend darstellen und unseren Stakeholdern klare Einblicke in relevante Kennzahlen bieten. Durch deine Arbeit unterstützt du Entscheidungsträger dabei, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und Chancen zu erkennen Methodik: Du wendest agile Methoden wie Scrum und Kanban an, um effizient zu arbeiten und sicherzustellen, dass unsere Projekte termingerecht und mit höchster Qualität abgeschlossen werden Dein Profil Erfahrung und Expertise : Du hast bereits erste Erfahrung als Data Analyst oder Scientist und verfügst über herausragende Fähigkeiten in der Analyse und Interpretation komplexer Datensätze Ausbildung : Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Fach oder einem ähnlichen Studiengang Analytische Fähigkeiten und Data Visualization : Du verfügst über ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu lösen und datengesteuerte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Du hast außerdem Erfahrung in der Erstellung aussagekräftiger Datenvisualisierungen, die komplexe Informationen einfach, klar und präzise darstellen Kommunikationsstärke und Business Partnership : Du bist in der Lage, komplexe Analysen klar und überzeugend in deutscher und englischer Sprache zu kommunizieren und bist ein starker Teamplayer, der effektiv mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammenarbeiten kann Modern Data Stack und Data Modelling : Du hast bereits mit einem Modern Data Stack gearbeitet und kennst die neuesten Tools und Technologien. Du bist erfahren im Entwerfen effektiver Datenstrukturen für optimale Analysen und Interpretation Eigeninitiative und Methodik : Du bist proaktiv und hast eine Leidenschaft für kontinuierliches Lernen und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Du wendest agile Methoden wie Scrum und Kanban an, um effizient zu arbeiten und sicherzustellen, dass unsere Projekte termingerecht und mit höchster Qualität abgeschlossen werden Warum wir? Chance : Du hast von Tag eins die Chance, eines der am stärksten und profitabel wachsenden Startups mitzugestalten und deinen Footprint zu hinterlassen Innovation : Du arbeitest in einem spannenden Umfeld, das einen etablierten und trägen Markt auf den Kopf stellt – und wir stellen dir dafür ein leistungsorientiertes sowie motiviertes Team und moderne Technologien zur Seite Team : Du arbeitest eng mit einem erfahrenen Data & Analytics Team und starkem Management aus Experten zusammen, das von offener Diskussion und gegenseitigem Lernen geprägt ist und hast die Möglichkeit dein Wissen zur Weiterentwicklung einer innovativen Plattform aktiv miteinzubringen Footprint : Du arbeitest mit uns an den drei globalen Trends Future of Work, Sustainability und Sharing Economy - so verändern wir gemeinsam die Welt zu einer besseren Werte : Wir sehen uns als eingeschworene Grown-Up Familie, die ihre Werte Mut, Authentizität und Nachhaltigkeit lebt. Zeig auch du uns, wie mutig du dich der Herausforderung stellst, um mit uns nachhaltige Erfolge zu feiern! Über uns Wir sind ein Game Changer - innovativ, zeitgemäß und anders. Ein Unternehmen, bei dem es Spaß macht, Kunde, Talent und vor allem Mitarbeiter zu sein. Falls du Lust auf ein herausragendes Business-Modell und eine nachhaltige Unternehmenskultur hast und Teil eines motivierten, leistungsstarken Teams werden willst, dann bist du bei yoummday genau richtig! Denn mit unserer Technologie revolutionieren wir die Arbeitswelt: Selbstbestimmtes Arbeiten unter fairen Bedingungen! Kunden können mit unserer Plattform ihre Customer Experience komplett virtuell aufsetzen und steuern. Gleichzeitig bietet unser Marktplatz Zugang zu weltweit arbeitenden Talenten. Preis, Qualität und Flexibilität sind bei uns keine Trade-Off-Entscheidungen – wir liefern exzellente Leistungen in allen Dimensionen. Du hast Lust auf Innovation und Revolution? Werde Daymaker! Jetzt bewerben Referenznummer YF-13277 (in der Bewerbung bitte angeben)
Show more

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Berlin (hybrid), fully remote within Germany

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.
Contribute to data-driven decision making through applying advanced analytics and statistics techniques for assessment of marketing and product tests.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects with proven experience in building and evaluating attribution models
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills and advanced knowledge of statistics.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes.
Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team, you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.
Show more

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
  • Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
  • Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.

What you need to be successful

  • Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
  • Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
  • Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
  • Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data

Nice to have:

  • Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
  • Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Analyst and Automation Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
SafeDriver Group GmbH is a leading company in the field of safe passenger transportation and an important service partner for innovative mobility companies and global players. With over 800 dedicated employees, we implement pioneering mobility solutions in Germany's urban centers. As a growing company, we are looking for an experienced and analytically strong personality to advance our group of companies as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/f/d).

Aufgaben


Performing data analysis and visualization with tools such as backends Google Cloud, AWS, Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Power BI.
Implementing machine learning models to predict business outcomes and optimize processes.
Analyzing large data sets to derive business trends and patterns.
Creating dashboards and reports to present insights to stakeholders.
stakeholders.
Collaborating with internal and external teams to implement data-driven projects.
Performing Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for data cleansing and preparation.
Development of statistical models and implementation of predictive models with Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and scikit-learn or similar.
Experience with ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load) and data pipelines an advantage.


Qualifikation


Degree in data science, information technology, business informatics or a related field (e.g. B.Sc. in Data Analytics, B.Sc. in International Economics & Management).
Practical experience in data analysis, data visualization and working with databases (SQL, NoSQL, Big Query).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Excel.
Experience with graph-based databases such as Neo4j or tools for processing unstructured data (e.g. Apache Kafka) is a plus.
Familiarity with machine learning and statistics (e.g. time series analysis, regression models).
Strong analytical thinking skills and ability to solve complex data problems.
Experience working with diverse stakeholders and the ability to make complex technical concepts understandable to non-technical teams.
Language skills: Fluent in English (C1), basic knowledge of German (B1 an advantage).


Benefits


A responsible position in a growing company with a lot of creative freedom.
A dynamic and challenging working environment with the opportunity to work on exciting projects.
The opportunity to actively shape strategic decisions and support the company on its growth path.
A dynamic and motivated team, as well as short decision-making paths.
Attractive remuneration and development opportunities.
Training opportunities and support for professional development.


We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We’re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based or hybrid, from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Standort: Berlin

Beschäftigungsart: Vollzeit

Gehalt: 65.000-80.000 EUR

Sprachkenntnisse: Deutsch C1 erforderlich







Für meinen renommierten Kunden in Berlin suche ich einen erfahrenen Data Analyst (m/w/d).




Deine Aufgaben:

Analyse großer Datenmengen zur Unterstützung datengetriebener Entscheidungsfindung
Entwicklung und Implementierung von Berichts- und Visualisierungslösungen (z. B. mit Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
Identifizierung von Trends, Mustern und Korrelationen in komplexen Datensätzen
Erstellung von Dashboards und KPI-Reports für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Stakeholdern zur Definition von Analyseanforderungen und zur Verbesserung von Geschäftsprozessen durch Datenanalysen
Optimierung von ETL-Prozessen und Integration von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und -konsistenz in allen Analyseprozessen

Dein Profil:

Abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachbereich wie Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Erfahrung in der Analyse großer Datenmengen sowie im Umgang mit Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (z. B. SQL)
Gute Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R
Erfahrung mit gängigen BI-Tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, o.ä.)
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Hohes analytisches Denkvermögen, eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten

Benefits:

Mobiles und flexibles Arbeiten, JobRad, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Corporate Benefits, uvm.
Individuelle persönliche und fachliche Weiterbildungen, Mentoring-Programme und Zertifizierungen
Austausch und Wissenstransfer zwischen verschiedenen Teams und Abteilungen
Umfangreiche Gesundheitsangebote, Mitarbeiterrabatte und weitere Zuschüsse







Interessierst du dich für diese spannende Herausforderung?




Dann bewirb dich noch heute bei mir! :)

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description


You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.



Required Qualifications

Mandatory


You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Desired


You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
You have a good mathematical understanding
An aerospace background is a plus
Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
An AWS certificate is a plus
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.



Behavioral skills


You have a solution-oriented mindset
You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility



We offer


An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
Flexibility to work from home
A comprehensive compensation package
20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries



If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.
Show more
HTML:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description

  • You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
  • You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
  • You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
  • You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
  • You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
  • You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
  • You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.


Required Qualifications

Mandatory

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
  • You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
  • You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
  • You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
  • You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Desired

  • You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
  • You have a good mathematical understanding
  • An aerospace background is a plus
  • Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
  • An AWS certificate is a plus
  • Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.


Behavioral skills

  • You have a solution-oriented mindset
  • You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility


We offer

  • An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
  • Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
  • International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
  • A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
  • Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
  • Flexibility to work from home
  • A comprehensive compensation package
  • 20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries


If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) - SCM
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description

What you'll get to do:


Conduct operations research, overhaul a set of relevant KPIs and support process transformation in partnership with the Head of SCM Finance, VP of SCM Finance, and the senior management.
Provide analytical support for projects related to over-shipping and under-shipping of materials by identifying operational gaps and assessing potential financial impacts.
Develop a deep knowledge of ERP data and use it to ensure proper usage and design of the ERP system in collaboration with the Operational Excellence and Digital Product teams, ensuring that all materials for customer deliveries and returns are accounted for in the inventory.
Automate SCM reporting by transitioning from Excel-based reports to a unified, automated system using our centralized data warehouse.
Closely work with stakeholders across Material Planning, Procurement and Hardware Engineering and overarching SCM teams to strategize and deliver reports supporting stock-out, alerting low stock levels and adoption rate of new products.



Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience as Senior BI Analyst, Senior Business Analyst or Data Analyst.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python (e.g. pandas) and Excel for quick a-hoc data analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of using data to improve business outcomes.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to operational excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Lead Analytics Analyst (f/m/x) - Data Analyst in AFC M&S Global Platform
Description:
Position Overview

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:


Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse



Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert



Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.


Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.



Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:


collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
development of models and data visualization
cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment



Your Competencies And Experience


You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable



This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.
